chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Pernell R LeFlore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes:
Credit For Time Served 232 Days.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Victims, their family or residence listed in the Criminal Complaint, Mighty Rams Motorcycle Club or Co-Actor.
Provide DNA Sample If not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

Joint/Several with Co-Actor - Defense requests a Restitution Hearing be scheduled.  Defendant to appear by Video Conferencing.

AMENDED 12-19-2014:  Court orders restitution in the amount of $3,774.24 to be paid as follows:  $1,568.78 payable to M.K. and $2,205.46 payable to Acuity Insurance.  Individuals to be paid first then Acuity Insurance.  Restitution is to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges and to be paid joint/several with co-actors.

From Dodge Correctional.

Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Pernell R LeFlore in court, in custody (Dodge Correctional by Video Conferencing), with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.
Restitution requested:  $3,774.24 (Breakdown:  $1,568.78 to M.K. and $2,205.46 to Acuity Insurance).

Both parties are prepared to proceed with a restitution hearing (no agreement).

Witnesses Called:  T.K. (Victim) and M.K. (Victim).

Exhibit #1 Marked (4 pages of photos - Showing Damages).
Exhibit #2 Marked (Police Report).
Exhibit #3 Marked (Packet of Receipts).
Exhibits 1 - 3 are offered and received.

State rests.
State presented closing arguments.
Defense presented closing arguments.
State presented response.

Court finds/orders the following:   Reasons placed on the record.
Court finds the State has met their burden of proof.
Court orders restitution in the amount of: $3,774.24 (Breakdown:  $1,568.78 to M.K. and $2,205.46 to Acuity Insurance, individuals to be paid first then acuity, restitution to be paid before all costs, fines or surcharges) - Joint/several with co-actors.
Amended J.O.C. to be prepared.
Associated with Charge #2
Restitution hearing on December 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.
